execution_summary: Docker image was generated from replication_info.json. First run failed due to uppercase variable names and missing 'year' column. Adjusted run_replication.py to load Stata uppercase variables, convert to lowercase, and detect year column. Re-executed successfully: data cleaned, 3-class clustering approximated latent classes, Welch t-test performed. Findings match hypothesised negative direction (post-secular lower endorsement).

code_executed.logs: Initial rows 18,304; 2012+ rows 9,727; after listwise deletion 2,269; t = -27.606, p < 0.0001. Output saved to replication_result.txt
code_executed.environment: Python 3.10 with pandas 1.5, numpy 1.23, scipy 1.10, kmodes 0.12, pyreadstat 1.2

results.hypothesis_tested: Respondents in the post-secular latent class are less likely than respondents in the traditional class to endorse human evolution.

findings_summary.outcome_name: Difference in mean endorsement of evolution
